attributes.action:
700 hours to ban fox hunting, 20 to allow state-sanctioned killing.
Let us vote
attributes.additional_details: Vulnerable populations could be pressured into ending their lives, fearing they're a burden. Legalization risks expansion and abuse. Trust between patients and doctors might erode, as doctors feel pressured to suggest assisted dying. Resources could be diverted from palliative care, focusing on cures over comfort. This could lead to a decline in end-of-life care and a slippery slope where the criteria for assisted dying expands.
attributes.background:
Like with the EU Referendum, this is something that affects the public directly.
Let the public vote!

If you're so sure on your decisions, then letting the public vote will prove it.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/701838
